Name: Cabinet for older New Yorkers.
Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to a cabinet for older New Yorkers

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Aging
This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
This Introduction was Laid Over by Committee

Summary: This bill would codify a Cabinet for Older New Yorkers, made up of the commissioners of city agencies or their designees and chaired by the commissioner of the Department for the Aging. The cabinet would facilitate inter-agency collaboration to improve services for older New Yorkers. The commissioner of the Department for the Aging would be required to report to the Council, the Public Advocate, the Comptroller, the Borough Presidents and the public on the activity of the Cabinet.

\pard\ltrpar\fi720\sl480\slmult1\qj Section 1. Chapter 66 of the New York city charter is amended by adding a new section 2405 to read as follows: \par
\ul\'a7 2405. Cabinet for older New Yorkers. a. Definitions. For the purposes of this section, the following terms have the following meanings:\par
Mayor\rquote s office for people with disabilities. The term \ldblquote mayor\rquote s office for people with disabilities\rdblquote  means the office established under executive order number 17 for the year 1990.\par
Mayor\rquote s office of talent and workforce development. The term \ldblquote mayor\rquote s office of talent and workforce development\rdblquote  means the office established under executive order number 22 for the year 2022.\par
NYC service. The term \ldblquote NYC service\rdblquote  means the division of the office of the mayor focused on volunteerism and service in New York city established in the year 2009.\par
b. The entities defined in subdivision a of this section shall include any successor office or other agency that carries out the same or substantially similar functions as such entities.\par
c. Cabinet. There shall be a cabinet for older New Yorkers. The cabinet shall meet at least once quarterly.\par
d. Duties. The cabinet shall facilitate coordination across agencies to further the elimination of age-related barriers and inequities in the provision of services to older adults and review current and future initiatives to ensure that such initiatives are inclusive of older adults. \par
e. Members. The cabinet shall be composed of the following members, or their designees: \par
1. Commissioner for the aging, who shall serve as chair;\par
2. Chair of the civic engagement commission;\par
3. Commissioner of information technology and telecommunications;\par
4. Commissioner of equity;\par
5. Chair of the commission on human rights;\par
6. Commissioner of consumer and worker protection;\par
7. Commissioner of cultural affairs; \par
8. Commissioner of health and mental hygiene; \par
9. Commissioner of housing preservation and development;\par
10. Commissioner of parks and recreation; \par
11. Police commissioner;\par
12. Commissioner of small business services;\par
13. Commissioner of social services;\par
14. Commissioner of transportation; \par
15. Commissioner of veterans\rquote  services;\par
16. Commissioner of youth and community development; \par
17. Chief service officer of NYC service;\par
18. Director of the office of community mental health;\par
19. Director of the office of criminal justice;\par
20. Director of the office of food policy;\par
21. Director of the office of immigrant affairs;\par
22. Commissioner of the mayor's office for people with disabilities;\par
23. Director of the office of talent and workforce development; and\par
24. Director of the office of urban agriculture.\par
f. Required invitations. The commissioner shall also invite to participate in the work of the cabinet the following persons, or their designees: \par
1. Chancellor of the city school district of the city of New York; \par
2. Chief executive officer of the New York city health and hospitals corporation;\par
3. Chief executive officer of the New York city housing authority;\par
4. President of the Brooklyn public library;\par
5. President of the New York public library; and\par
6. President of the Queens public library.\par
g. Optional invitations. The commissioner may invite representatives of any relevant federal, state, or local entity to participate in the work of the cabinet.\par
h. Report. One year after the effective date of the local law that added this section and annually thereafter, the commissioner shall submit to the speaker of the council, the public advocate, the comptroller, and the Bronx, Brooklyn, Manhattan, Queens, and Staten Island borough presidents, and post on the website of the department a report on the work of the cabinet. Such report shall include, but need not be limited to:\par
1. Actions taken or proposed as a result of the meeting of such cabinet; \par
2. Attendance at cabinet meetings; and \par
3. Minutes of cabinet meetings.\par
\pard\ltrpar\qj\ulnone\'a7 2. This local law takes effect 90 days after it becomes law. \fs18\par
